page.title: 06Schools - Brent Villages
page.content: The village of Brent Knoll has one primary school which was built in 1861. It has two classes and is for children aged 4 to 11. The original building is still in use and there are 2 additional buildings for classrooms. There is a large playing field. In East Brent there are 2 schools. A first school (see page 5) and a private girls school known as Rossholme. This is housed in the old vicarage near to the church. It is a boarding school which also takes day pupils. There are about 80 pupils all girls aged between 5 and 18. The sports ground is part of the Knoll and once belonged to the church. It has tennis courts and a swimming pool.
